context: The Finnish verb 'lentää' means 'to fly'. It is an intransitive and transitive verb, meaning it can be used both with and without a direct object. The form 'lentää' is the present tense third-person singular indicative form, which doesn’t exhibit final gemination unlike the first infinitive.  The word has many conjugations depending on the tense, person, and mood, as shown in the dictionary definition. It can also mean to move quickly or even fall down.
